metadata.title: CVE-2014-9911 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the ures_getByKeyWithFallback function incommon/uresbund.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) before54.1 for C/C++ allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted uloc_getDisplayNamecall.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libicu55 - 55.1-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
oxide-qt package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
mozjs24: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
icu package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '55.1-7').
